did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: James Ryan Morris papers, 1959-1978
did.abstract: The collection consists primarily of letters to James Ryan Morris from poets Diane Di Prima, Theodore Enslin, Jack Hirschman, William J. Margolis, Dan Propper, and Stuart Zane Perkoff.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

The user agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Arizona Board of Regents for the University of Arizona, its officers, employees, and agents from and against all claims made by any person asserting that he or she is an owner of copyright.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: James Ryan Morris papers(MS 268).Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: James Ryan Morris, born in New York City in 1935, served as a marine in Korea. He co-founded and co-edited the literay magazine Sight until its cessation in 1958, founded The Croupier (Seattle, 1965-?) and Mile High Underground (Denver, 1966-1967). Published collections of Morris' own poetry include She Said, The Rat's Nest, Diana's Smile, He Has Heard, 13 Sounds, .22 For Her, and The Hands. He has also published poetry postcards and broadsides.Morris died in 1978.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into five series.

list.item: Series III: Poetry and Published Works, 1961-1977
Series V: Miscellaneous Poetry and Graphics, 1967-1971

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists primarily of letters to James Ryan Morris from poets Diane Di Prima, Theodore Enslin, Jack Hirschman, William J. Margolis, Dan Propper, and Stuart Zane Perkoff. Letters from Perkoff to Anthony Scibella and Maxine Cherry are included, as well as typescripts and holographs of Perkoff's poetry. The collection also includes other correspondence, poetry books, poems, broadsides, two unidentified photographs, and graphics.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Publications received with the collection were removed and catalogued separately.
